decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize an aggro strategy with Aragorn, King of Gondor as the commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis, Brazen Borrower, and Dragon's Rage Channeler, mixed with efficient removal and disruption spells like Chain Lightning, Swords to Plowshares, and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board early on and apply pressure to the opponent, using Aragorn's abilities to its advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also providing flexibility and consistency in casting spells.

This deck revolves around deploying a quick and aggressive board presence with small, cheap creatures known as "weenies" in white. The strategy focuses on overwhelming the opponent with early creature aggression and disruptive spells to control the game tempo. The commander, Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, supports this strategy by providing additional benefits to your creatures. The deck includes a mix of utility creatures, removal spells, and powerful equipment to enhance the aggressiveness of your creatures. It also includes a range of protection spells to keep your key pieces safe. Overall, the goal of this deck is to establish a dominant board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck revolves around utilizing a variety of small creatures and sacrifice effects to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck focuses on generating value from sacrificing creatures and bringing them back from the graveyard to create a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion of small creatures and enchantments to maintain board presence. With a mix of removal spells, lifegain, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up its own board presence to overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this control deck is to manipulate the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan. Lazav, Wearer of Faces serves as the commander, utilizing its ability to become a copy of creatures in the graveyard to control the battlefield. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage cards to maintain control over the game. By using cards like Force of Will, Cryptic Command, and Counterspell, the deck aims to stop the opponent's threats and protect its own game plan. Additionally, cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead provide graveyard recursion to reuse powerful creatures. Overall, the key strategy is to outmaneuver the opponent and establish dominance through disruption and resource management.
